content:
I'm debugging a module that I'm porting and I see this in the log but don't know where to find what's causing it. There don't seem to be any theme hooks for 'html' in the module. Any ideas how I can proceed?

Theme hook "html" not found.
@Laryn maybe try looking for something like theme('html'
Thanks, should have thought of that! I do see that. It's present in the D7 code as well -- is that something that got removed from Drupal or ??
It looks like it's just trying to generate a complete page -- is the equivalent in Backdrop theme('layout'?
I was reluctant to mention it, because I was sure you had already done that. :slight_smile:
Maybe it's something that module defined at one point but removed. Try looking through the commit history or with git blame to see if there are any clues there.
It does seem logical that I would have done. I had tried grepping theme_ and _theme (looked in the theme hook function) and theme_html and just _html but not theme( :rolling_eyes:
^^ that used to always get me... API documentation always mentions theme_whatever() functions, but their actual implementation is always theme('whatever'). I've learned my lesson since.
